abstract.text: Creates an FTP read stream.

inlineContent.text: Use NSURLSessionAPI for ftp requests

This function creates an FTP read stream for downloading data from an FTP URL. If the
parameter is created with the user name and password as part of the URL (such as
) then the user name and password will automatically be set in the
. Otherwise, call
to set the steamâ€™s properties, such as
and
to associate a user name and password with the stream that are used to log in when the stream is opened. See
for a description of all FTP stream properties.
To initiate a connection with the FTP server, call
. To read the FTP stream, call
. If the URL refers to a directory, the stream provides the listing results sent by the server. If the URL refers to a file, the stream provides the data in that file.
To close a connection with the FTP server, call

abstract.text: Access network services and handle changes in network configurations. Build on abstractions of network protocols to simplify tasks such as working with BSD sockets, administering HTTP and FTP servers, and managing Bonjour services.
Creates a read stream for a CFHTTP request message.
Creates a read stream for a CFHTTP request message object whose body is too long to keep in memory.
Creates an FTP read stream.
Creates an FTP write stream.

HTTP Final Request property. A value of type CFHTTPMessage containing the final message transmitted by the stream after all modifications (including authentication, connection policy, redirects, and so on) have been made. This property cannot be set.
HTTP Final URL property. A value of type CFURL containing the final HTTP URL. This value differs from the URL in the original HTTP request if an autoredirection occurred. This property cannot be set.
HTTP Response Header property. When copied by
, the header of an HTTP response message is returned.
HTTP Should Auto Redirect property. Set this property to
to enable autoredirection; set this property to
to disable autoredirection.
Sets the value of a property for a stream.
Reads data from a readable stream.
Closes a readable stream.
Returns the value of a property for a stream.
Opens a stream for reading.
A reference to a CFAllocator object.
A reference to a readable stream object.
A reference to a CFURL object.
A type for propagating an unmanaged object reference.
